law.catch_line: With respect to any claim, a member of the Board may:...

text.section:
With respect to any claim, a member of the Board may:
administer oaths; and
issue subpoenas to compel:
the attendance of witnesses; and
the production of pertinent records or documents.

The Board may petition a circuit court for an order of contempt against a person who refuses to:
comply with a subpoena issued by a Board member;
comply with a request by a Board member to be sworn to an oath; or
answer as a witness before the Board.
